main event: Multiple observers reported seeing a round white object resembling a flare descending in a downward arc at Hall Lake, N.W.T., Canada, on February 20, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a basketball with a whitish vapor trail lasting 5-10 minutes., Observers saw two bright flashes during the object's descent., The object was seen by personnel at Hall Lake and West Melville, all reporting similar experiences., Weather conditions were clear with unlimited visibility at the time of the sighting., There were various conclusions drawn about the object, including possibilities of it being a balloon, meteor, or satellite.
sighted object: Round white object resembling a magnesium flare
witness description: Heavy equipment operators and other personnel employed by Federal Electric Corp.
